_header: Mary mother well thou be / Mary maiden think on me
Note: For an expansion into long lines see 3423.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, prayers to; prayers, to Virgin Mary
_description: An orison to the Virgin Mary in the Speculum Christiani (Octaua Tabula) — twenty-seven couplets

BodAddA268.First Lines:
MArie moder wele þou bemary maiden þenke on memaiden
                    & moder was neuer nonto geder ladie but þou
                    allon…
BodAddA268.Last Lines:
…& shilde me out of dedly synneþat I be neuer taken
                    þer inne

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Mary moder wele þu beMary moder thinke on meModer and
                    mayd was neuer noneIn þis werld bot þu A lone…
BodAsh61.Last Lines: …That I may fynd it so beAmen Amen for charyte
BodAsh61.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Private Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Studies in Philology
         36 (1939): 466-75: 468-9.
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 73-4; 454-6; 602.

BLHar2382.First Lines: Mary moder well thu beMary mayden thenk on me…
BLHar2382.Last Lines:
…and kepe me out of dedly synnethat I be not y take ther
                    ynne
BLHar2382.Note:
Usually in Speculum Christiani, Octava Tabula, but here extracted
                    and occurring separately; ends ‘Amen’ and
                        ‘Explicit’ (f. 87)
BLHar2382.Attributed Title:
Oracio Sanctam Mariam (ff. 86v-87, in upper margin, as
                    running title, by scribe)

BLHar5396.First Lines: Mare moder wele þu beMare maydyn thynk on me>…

BLHar5396.Note: This witness standing alone, not in the Speculum Christiani; ends “Explicit.”

MAri modir wel þow bemodir and mayde thenke on
                    me…

                    haue that blisthat euere shal last with oute mis

Longleat29.First Lines:
Mary modyr wel þe be Mary modyr þou þynke on meModyr
                    & Maid was neuere none To gyddyr mary bot þou alo[ne?
                    (gutter)]
Longleat29.Last Lines:
…Mary I fiche me in the þis prayer graunt þou to
                    meAnd help me to haue þat ilk blisse þat euer lesteth without
                    myssheAMEN

Longleat30.First Lines: MAry moder wel thow beMary moder thenke on me…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…And kepe me out of dedly synneThat I be neuer take ther ynne
                    Amen
Longleat30.Attributed Title:
Sivis dei graciam & vitam eternam obtinere dic / quotidie istam
                        oracionem sequentem de sancta maria / mater domini nostri ihesu cristi
                        Oracio (f. 21v)

PULSchei127.First Lines:
Mary moder well þu beEuere mylde þenk on meModer
                    & mayde was neuer noneTo geder lasy but the oneMary moder &
                    mayde cleneShyld me fro Sorowe & tene…
PULSchei127.Last Lines:
…Shild me lady fro velonyAnd fro wyckyd companySwete
                    moder & maide myelde…
PULSchei127.Note:
Added to blank page at end of volume by a different hand of the
                    fifteenth century; imperfect at end — only five 4-line stanzas rhyming
                    aabb and first line of sixth. Not set out as stanzas, but 21 lines written one
                    after the other without line break between stanzas. Previously registered in
                        Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943 as 3279.

HunHM124.First Lines:
Mary modir wel thou beMary modir thenk on meMayden and modir
                    was neuer nooneTo gedir lady but thou alone…
HunHM124.Last Lines:
…And schilde me out of deedely synneThat I be neuer take there
                    ynne

HunHM142.Last Lines:
…Do my folyes for to blynneAnd kepe me oute of deedly
                    synneThat I be neuer take ther Inne
HunHM142.Note:
Last three lines only, except for introductory words, as above, which
                    follow the heading on f. 18v and may have been added
                    later.
HunHM142.Attributed Title:
Si vis dei graciam et vitam rectam obtinere dic quotidie istam oracionem
                        sequentem de sancta maria mater domini nostri ihesu cristi. Oracio (f.
                        18v)
